elements.title: Oakland California Temple (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Federal Aviation Administration uses the brightly lit Oakland California Temple (pictured) as a navigation beacon, despite complaints about light pollution?

elements.title: Will Tschetter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Will Tschetter had the highest scoring average in Minnesota in basketball and won the state discus throw championship?

elements.title: Armenian Rite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that within the Armenian Rite, it takes 40 days and more than 40 flowers, herbs, and spices to create the chrism known as myron?

elements.title: Shigeichi Negishi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that because karaoke sounds like the Japanese word for 'coffin', Shigeichi Negishi called his karaoke machine prototype the "Sparko Box"?

elements.title: Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the developers of Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas walked out of the Game Developers Choice Awards after winning nothing?

elements.title: Wilner Burke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wilner Burke was the director of the Lumberjack Band, the marching band of the Green Bay Packers, for 42 years?

elements.title: Biostack experiment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that as part of the Apollo 17 Biostack experiment scientists found that cosmic rays could cause brine shrimp larvae to grow two abdomens or have short limbs?

elements.title: Mattie Edwards (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that actress Mattie Edwards was made a US deputy marshal at the age of sixteen?

elements.title: a New Zealand coin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the design on a New Zealand coin was incorrectly alleged to represent a "personified phallus"?
